entry.title: Russian border guards leave Armenia‚Äôs international airport

media:group.media:title: Russian border guards leave Armenia‚Äôs international airport
media:group.media:description:
üìç Russian border guards withdrew from Yerevan‚Äôs Zvartnots airport, where they had been stationed since just after Armenia‚Äôs independence. üìç Turkey‚Äôs foreign minister reaffirmed that his country‚Äôs border with Armenia will not be reopened until a normalization deal with Azerbaijan is reached. üìç The United States suspended more than $95 million in aid to Georgia following the passage of a Russia-inspired foreign agent law, at a time when the West is forging deeper ties with Armenia. üìç The Armenian government set up a company to plan the construction of a new nuclear plant to replace the aging Metsamor facility.

entry.title: Bringing tech startups to life at Armenia‚Äôs Sevan Startup Summit

media:group.media:title: Bringing tech startups to life at Armenia‚Äôs Sevan Startup Summit
media:group.media:description:
Hundreds of startuppers gathered last week to network and pitch their solutions to 21st century problems at a camp on the shore of Armenia‚Äôs Lake Sevan. As the largest such gathering in the region, the Sevan Startup Summit is a valuable opportunity for early-stage entrepreneurs to connect with one another and entice investors. CivilNet spoke with participants and business experts at the summit about the significance of tech startups in developing economies across the world.
